allianz.bonuses_some_locked: You have joined the alliance on [DATE] at [TIME]. With that not all bonuses are applying yet. Check below to see which bonuses are not yet active.
allianz.bonuses_description: Your alliance provides bonuses for your villages. Donate resources to a bonus to increase the advantage. As bonuses need a big amount of resources, the whole alliance should donate to this cause.
allianz.TroopProductionSpeedDescription: Sharing knowledge within your alliance is key to success. With the combined knowledge how to drill recruits faster, your alliance will have a strong army in offense and defense. Its even the only way to further improve the training time of siege weapons.
allianz.CPProductionDescription: Even with so much fighting going on within the world of Travian Artists generate Culture Points. With the help of your alliance, these masters of art will be able to increase your Culture Point production. It will not affect the CP-Gain of Artworks.
allianz.SmithyPowerDescription: There are many secrets about how to forge steel even harder, even sharper. Sharing these secrets within your alliance will result in stronger units.
allianz.MerchantCapacityDescription: Within an alliance not only military aid is needed, also support with resources to push a village at front line is crucial. The talent of your merchants will allow you to pack more resources on their carts.
allianz.bonus_details_locked_active: To reach the next bonus level the alliance still needs to donate [AMOUNT_NEEDED] resources.
allianz.bonus_details_locked_upgrading: Level up in progress. The prior bonus is still available, and will be replaced with this bonus on [DATE] at [TIME].

allianz.allianceBonus_headerDescription: Teamwork is the key to success in the world of Travian. Contribute resources to get bonus rewards for the whole alliance and increase the advantage over the others. As bonuses need big amounts of resources, the whole alliance needs to contribute to this cause.
allianz.allianceBonus_sitterNotAllowedToContribu: As a sitter you have no permission to contribute resources.
allianz.allianceBonus_dailyContributionLimitReac: You have reached your daily contribution limit. Reset in [RESET_COUNTDOWN].
allianz.TroopProductionSpeedExtendedDescription: Sharing military insights can be substantial in winning a war. Advancements in siege engine development and well-schooled instructors will increase the size of your army faster.
allianz.CPProductionExtendedDescription: For an empire to thrive you need more than just an army. Provide education in human sciences for your people to become pioneers in architecture and village planning. An influential culture will encourage foreign nations to accept your rule.
allianz.SmithyPowerExtendedDescription: Throughout history, conflicts were determined by the same principle: You gotta have the bigger stick. Upgraded armor and enhanced weaponry will enable your soldiers to overpower their enemies.
allianz.MerchantCapacityExtendedDescription: A battle without resupplies is a battle lost. Packhorses and bigger carts facilitate your merchants to carry more resources to where they are needed most, be it the front or a comrade in need.

Everyone should be happy to have you in their confederacy!<br/><br/>Have fun and good luck.

manual.tid1: The Legionnaire is the simple and all-purpose infantry of the Roman Empire. With his well-rounded training, he is good at both defence and offence. However, the Legionnaire will never reach the levels of the more specialized troops.
manual.tid2: The Praetorians are the emperor's guard and they defend him with their life. Because their training is specialized for defence, they are very weak attackers.
manual.tid3: The Imperian is the ultimate attacker of the Roman Empire. He is quick, strong, and the nightmare of all defenders. However, his training is expensive and time-intensive.
manual.tid4: The Equites Legati are the roman reconnaissance troops. They are pretty fast and can spy on enemy villages in order to see resources and troops.<br /><br />If there are no Scouts, Equites Legati or Pathfinders in the scouted village, the scouting remains unnoticed.
manual.tid5: The Equites Imperatoris are the standard cavalry of the roman army and are very well armed. They are not the fastest troops, but are a horror for unprepared enemies. You should, however, always keep in mind that catering for horse and rider isn't cheap.
manual.tid6: The Equites Caesaris are the heavy cavalry of Rome. They are very well armoured and deal great amounts of damage, but all that armour and weaponry comes with a price. They are slow, carry less resources and feeding them is expensive.
manual.tid7: The Battering ram is a heavy support weapon for your infantry and cavalry. Its task is to destroy the enemy walls and therefore increase your troops’ chances of overcoming the enemy's fortifications.
manual.tid8: The Catapult is an excellent long-distance weapon; it is used to destroy the fields and buildings of enemy villages. However, without escorting troops, it is almost defenceless, so don't forget to send some of your troops with it. <br /><br />Having a high level rally point makes your catapults more accurate and gives you the option to target additional enemy buildings. More information is available <a href="http://t4.answers.travian.com/?view=answers&action=answer&aid=157#go2answer" target=blank>here</a>.<br />HINT: Catapults CAN hit the cranny, trappers or stonemason's lodges when they target randomly.
manual.tid9: The Senator is the tribe's chosen leader. He's a good speaker and knows how to convince others. He is able to persuade other villages to fight for your empire. <br /><br />Every time the Senator speaks to the inhabitants of a village, the enemy's loyalty value decreases until the village is yours.
manual.tid10: Settlers are brave and daring citizens who move out of the village after a long training session to found a new village in your honour. <br /><br />As the journey and the founding of the new village are very difficult, three settlers are bound to stick together. They need a basic supplies of 750 units per resource.
manual.tid11: Clubswingers are the cheapest unit in Travian. They are quickly trained and have medium attack capabilities, but their armour isn’t the best. Clubswingers are almost defenceless against cavalry and will be ridden down with ease.
manual.tid12: In the Teuton army, the Spearman’s task is defence. He is especially good against cavalry thanks to his weapons' length.<br /><br />However, avoid using him in attacks, because his offensive capabilities are very low.
manual.tid13: This is the Teuton's strongest infantry unit. He is strong at both offence and defence but he is slower and more expensive than other units.
manual.tid14: The Scout moves far ahead of the Teuton troops in order to get an impression of the enemy's strength and his villages. He moves on foot, which makes him slower than his Roman or Gaul counterparts. He scouts the enemy units, resources and fortifications. <br /><br />If there are no enemy Scouts, Pathfinders or Equites Legati in the scouted village then the scouting remains unnoticed.
manual.tid15: As they are equipped with heavy armour, Paladins are a great defensive unit. Infantry will find it especially difficult to overcome his mighty shield. <br /><br />Unfortunately, their attacking capabilities are rather low and their speed, compared to other cavalry units, is below average. Their training takes very long and is rather expensive.
manual.tid16: The Teutonic Knight is a formidable warrior and instills fear and despair in his foes. In defence, he stands out against enemy cavalry. However, the cost of training and feeding him is extraordinary.
manual.tid17: The Ram is a heavy support weapon for your infantry and cavalry. Its task is to destroy enemy walls and therefore increase your troops’ chances of overcoming the enemy's fortifications.
manual.tid18: The Catapult is an excellent long-distance weapon; it is used to destroy the fields and buildings of enemy villages. However, without escorting troops it is almost defenceless, so don't forget to send some of your troops with it. <br /><br />Having a high-level rally point makes your catapults more accurate and gives you the option to target additional enemy buildings. More information is available <a href="http://t4.answers.travian.com/?view=answers&action=answer&aid=169#go2answer" target=blank>here</a>.<br />HINT: Catapults CAN hit the cranny, trappers or stonemason's lodges when they target randomly.
manual.tid19: Among their best, the Teutons choose their Chief. To be chosen, bravery and strategy aren't enough; you also have to be a formidable speaker as it is the Chief's primary objective to convince the population of foreign villages to join the Chief's tribe. <br /><br />The more often the Chief speaks to the population of a village, the more the loyalty of the village sinks until it finally joins the chief's tribe.
manual.tid20: Settlers are brave and daring citizens who move out of the village after a long training session to found a new village in your honour. <br /><br />As the journey and the founding of the new village are very difficult, three settlers are bound to stick together. They need a basic supplies of 750 units per resource.
manual.tid21: Since they are infantry, the Phalanx is cheap and fast to produce. <br /><br />Though their attack power is low, in defence they are quite strong against both infantry and cavalry.
manual.tid22: The Swordsmen are more expensive than the Phalanx, but they are an offensive unit.<br /><br />They are quite weak in defence, especially against cavalry.
manual.tid23: The Pathfinder is the Gaul's reconnaissance unit. They are very fast and they can make a surreptitious advance on enemy units, resources or buildings in order to spy on them.<br /><br />If there aren't any Scouts, Equites Legati or Pathfinders in the scouted village, the scouting remains unnoticed.
manual.tid24: Theutates Thunders are very fast and powerful cavalry units. They can carry a large amount of resources which makes them excellent raiders too.<br /><br />When it comes to defence, their abilities are average at best.
manual.tid25: This medium cavalry unit is brilliant at defence. The main purpose of the Druidrider is to defend against enemy infantry. Its training cost and food supply are relatively expensive.
manual.tid26: The Haeduans are the Gaul's ultimate weapon for both offence and defence against cavalry. Few units can match their prowess.<br /><br />However, their training and equipment are very expensive. So you should think very carefully if they will be worth the effort and expenses.
manual.tid27: The Ram is a heavy support weapon for your infantry and cavalry. Its task is to destroy the enemy walls and thus increase your troops’ chances of overcoming the enemy's fortifications.
manual.tid28: The Trebuchet is an excellent long-distance weapon; it is used to destroy the fields and buildings of enemy villages. However, without escorting troops it is almost defenceless, so don't forget to send some of your troops with it.<br /><br />Having a high-level rally point makes your catapults more accurate and gives you the option to target additional enemy buildings. More information is available <a href="http://t4.answers.travian.com/?view=answers&action=answer&aid=146#go2answer" target=blank>here</a>.<br />HINT: Catapults CAN hit the cranny, trappers or stonemason's lodges when they target randomly.
manual.tid29: Each tribe has an ancient and experienced fighter whose presence and speeches are able to convince the population of enemy villages to join his tribe.<br /><br />The more often the Chieftain speaks in front of the walls of an enemy village, the more its loyalty sinks until it joins the Chieftain's tribe.
manual.tid30: Settlers are brave and daring citizens who move out of the village after a long training session to found a new village in your honour.<br /><br />As the journey and the founding of the new village are very difficult, three settlers are bound to stick together. They need a basis of 750 units per resource.
manual.ingamehilfe_beschreibung: This ingame manual offers you the possibility to read up on important information at any time.
manual.spielanleitung_beschreibung: This ingame manual just gives you basic information. More information is available at<a href="http://t4.answers.travian.com/" target=blank>Travian Answers</a>.
manual.gid1: The woodcutter cuts down trees in order to produce lumber. The further you extend the woodcutter, the more lumber is produced.<br><br>By constructing a sawmill, you can further increase the production.
manual.gid2: Here, clay is produced. By increasing its level, you increase clay production.<br><br>By constructing a brickyard, you can further increase the production.
manual.gid3: Here, miners gather the precious resource of iron. By increasing the mine's level, you increase its iron production.<br><br>By constructing an iron foundry, you can further increase the production.
manual.gid4: Your population's food is produced here. By increasing the cropland's level, you increase crop production. <br><br>By constructing a grain mill and a bakery, you can further increase the production.
manual.gid5: Lumber cut by your woodcutters is processed here. Based on its level, your sawmill can increase your lumber production by up to 25 percent.
manual.gid6: The brickyard converts clay into bricks. Based on its level, your brickyard can increase your clay production by up to 25 percent.
manual.gid7: The iron foundry melts iron. Based on its level, your iron foundry can increase your iron production by up to 25 percent.
manual.gid8: The grain mill grinds grain into flour. Based on its level, your grain mill can increase your crop production by up to 25 percent.
manual.gid9: The bakery uses flour to make bread. In conjunction to the grain mill, the increase in crop production can go up to 50 percent in total.
manual.gid10: The resources lumber, clay and iron are stored in the warehouse. By increasing its level, you increase your warehouse's capacity.
manual.gid11: The crop produced on your farms is stored in the granary. By increasing its level, you increase the granary’s capacity.
manual.gid13: The weapons and armour of your warriors are enhanced in the smithy's melting furnaces. By increasing its level, you can order the fabrication of even better weapons and armour.
manual.gid14: Your troops can increase their stamina at the Tournament Square. The further the building is upgraded, the faster your troops are beyond a minimum distance of 20 squares.
manual.gid15: The village's master builders live in the main building. The higher its level the faster your master builders complete the construction of new buildings.
manual.gid16: Your village's troops gather here. From here, you can send them out to conquer, raid or reinforce other villages. <br /><br />The rally point can only be built on the green grassland below and to the right of your main building.
manual.gid17: At the marketplace, you can trade resources with other players. The higher its level, the more resources can be transported by your merchants at the same time.
manual.gid18: The embassy is a place for diplomats. At level 1 you can join an alliance, and after extending it to level 3 you may even found one yourself. <br /><br />The maximum number of possible members in an alliance is equal to 3 times the level of the highest level embassy within that alliance. Therefore, with a level 20 embassy, there can be up to 60 players in an alliance.
manual.gid19: Infantry can be trained in the barracks. The higher its level, the faster the troops are trained.
manual.gid20: Cavalry can be trained in the stable. The higher its level, the faster the troops are trained.
manual.gid21: Siege engines, like catapults and rams, can be built in the workshop. The higher its level, the faster these units are produced.
manual.gid22: New unit types can be researched in the academy. By increasing its level, you can order the research of better units.
manual.gid23: The cranny hides some of your resources in case the village gets attacked. These resources cannot get stolen. <br /><br />At level 1 the cranny can hold 200 of each resource. The capacity of Gallic crannies is 1.5 times larger.<br /><br />If a Teutonic hero attacks a village, crannies can hide only 80% of their normal capacity.
manual.gid24: In the town hall, you can hold pompous celebrations. Such a celebration increases your culture points (= CP). <br /><br />Culture points are necessary to found or conquer new villages. Each building produces culture points and the higher its level, the more CP it produces. With celebrations, you can increase this production for a short while.
manual.gid25: The residence is a small palace where the King or Queen resides when he or she visits the village. The residence protects the village against enemies who want to conquer it.
manual.gid26: The King or Queen of the empire lives in the palace. A village with a level 10 palace can be made your capital village. Capital villages cannot be conquered.<br /><br />The capital is the only place where a stonemason's lodge can be built and resource fields can be extended beyond level 10.
manual.gid27: The riches of your empire are kept in the treasury. A treasury can only store one artefact at a time.<br /><br />You need a treasury at level 10 for a small artefact, or level 20 for a great one.
manual.gid28: In the trade office, the merchants' carts get improved and equipped with more powerful horses. The higher its level, the more your merchants are able to carry.
manual.gid29: The great barracks allows you to build more units at the same time but they cost thrice the original amount. <br /><br />It cannot be built in the capital.
manual.gid30: The great stable allows you to build more units at the same time but they cost thrice the original amount. <br /><br />It cannot be built in the capital.
manual.gid31: By building a city wall, you can protect your village against the barbarian hordes of your enemies. The higher its level, the higher is the bonus given to your forces' defense.<br /><br />The city wall can only be built by Romans.<br /><br />The city wall offers the biggest defence bonus, but it is easier to destroy than the Gaulish palisade or the Teutonic earth wall.
manual.gid32: By building an earth wall, you can protect your village against the barbarian hordes of your enemies. The higher its level, the higher is the bonus given to your forces' defense.<br /><br />The earth wall can only be built by Teutons.<br /><br />The earth wall offers the lowest defence bonus but it is almost impossible to destroy it.
manual.gid33: By building a palisade, you can protect your village against the barbarian hordes of your enemies. The higher its level, the higher is the bonus given to your forces' defense.<br /><br />The palisade can only be built by Gauls, its defence bonus and its durability is between that of the Teutonic earth wall and the Roman city wall.
manual.gid34: The stonemason's lodge is an expert at cutting stone. The further the building is extended, the higher the stability of the village's buildings. <br /><br />It can only be built in the capital.
manual.gid35: Tasty mead is brewed in the brewery and later quaffed by the soldiers during the celebrations. <br /><br />These drinks make your soldiers braver and stronger when attacking others (1% per level). Unfortunately, the chiefs’ power of persuasion is decreased and catapults can only do random hits.<br /><br />It can only be built by Teutons and only in their capital. It affects the whole empire.
manual.gid36: The trapper protects your village with well hidden traps. This means that unwary enemies can be imprisoned and won't be able to harm your village any more.<br /><br />Troops cannot be freed with a raid. If the owner of the traps release the captives all of the traps will be repaired automatically.<br /><br />The trapper can only be constructed by Gauls.
manual.gid37: The hero's mansion is the home of your glorious hero.<br /><br />At building levels 10, 15 and 20, you can use your hero to annex an unoccupied oasis to your village, one per each of these levels respectively. Depending on the oasis, you will get a production increase for a certain type of resource (or even two resources, from some oases).
manual.gid38: The great warehouse has 3 times the capacity of a normal warehouse.<br><br>This building can only be built in wonder of the world villages or with a special Natarian artefact.
manual.gid39: The great granary has 3 times the capacity of a normal granary.<br><br>This building can only be built in wonder of the world villages or with a special Natarian artefact.
manual.gid40: The Wonder of the World represents the pride of all architecture. Only the mightiest and richest are able to build such a master work and defend it against envious enemies.<br /><br />Wonders of the World can only be erected in one of the old Natarian villages. However, a construction plan is also necessary. Starting with level 50, an additional plan is needed for its completion. The second plan one has to be owned by another player in the same alliance.
manual.gid41: The horse drinking trough cares for the well-being of your horses and therefore increases the speed of their training.<br /><br />The horse drinking trough reduces the crop usage for the following soldiers: Equites Legati from level 10, Equites Imperatoris from level 15 and Equites Caesaris from level 20.<br /><br />The horse drinking trough can only be built by Romans.
manual.direktlinks_be1: By using the direct links, you can set up links to any desired location/page and speed up your navigation.
manual.direktlinks_be2: Adding an * to the URL will cause the direct link to open in a new window.
manual.eventstau_text: <p>All events occurring at a later time get calculated by an event system. In case the server is overloaded or the connection between the web server and the database is slow, an event jam can occur.</p><p>If more events are received per second than can be calculated per second, events (e.g. "construction finished" or "troops arrived") will be put into a waiting loop.</p><p>The chronological order of troop movements stays the same, even in case of an event jam, so troops that would normally arrive somewhere first would still arrive there as planned.</p><p>As a player, nothing can be done against an event jam except for waiting it out. Normally, these problems get resolved after a few minutes automatically. At the moment, [INT] events are waiting to get calculated.</p>
manual.top10_text1: <p>The Top 10 statistics are recreated each week and are valid from Monday 00:00 until Sunday 24:00 GMT+1.</p>
manual.top10_text2: <p>At the end of each week, the top ten players are awarded a special decoration. When you edit your profile, a certain code (e.g. [#123]) is displayed at "medals" which can be inserted where desired. Examples:</p>
manual.random_artefact_text: Wanting nothing more then glory and fame for himself, an ancient Natarian emperor order his finest craftsmen to construct magical items which would come to be known as artefacts.Taking up this challenge, they began working on these powerful creations. But their first attempt could not have gone more horribly right. They created a powerful item capable of giving any power they could think of at the time of making it.It only possessed one slight downside; although it could grant any bonus to its holder, it changed its power every 24h. For this reason, the crafters named it the Artefact of fools.
manual.ally_top10_text1: <p>The Top 10 alliance statistics are recreated each week and are valid from Monday 00:00 until Sunday 24:00 GMT+1.</p>
manual.ally_top10_text2: <p>At the end of each week, the top ten alliances are awarded a special decoration. When you edit the alliance profile, a certain code (e.g. [#123]) is displayed at "medals" which can be inserted where desired. Examples:</p>
manual.ally_top10_kat_aufsteiger_desc: total population increase of all players within the alliance
manual.tid51: The Slave Militia is the cheapest unit with the shortest production time in the game. While this allows you to raise a defense very quickly, they compare poorly in fighting strength to other defensive troops.
manual.tid52: The Ash Warden is your standard defensive foot soldier with solid combat power. They fare exceptionally well against other infantry, yet their defense against cavalry should not be overlooked.
manual.tid53: The Khopesh Warrior is an elite soldier boasting both a strong offense and remarkable defense against other warriors on foot.
manual.tid54: The Sopdu Explorer rides out into unknown territory to explore the area and count the soldiers of your enemies. They are also able to critically examine opposing villages and detect any weak points.
manual.tid55: The Anhur Guard is a mounted defender that dominates any attacking infantry. In addition to moderate ability in offense and defense against cavalry, they are the fastest Egyptian unit after the Sopdu Explorer.
manual.tid56: The Resheph Chariot is well-versed in all fields of combat. They pack a heavy offensive punch as well as a very solid defense against infantry, though they truly excel at defending against cavalry. In return, they are very costly to train and consume plenty of crop.
manual.tid57: The Ram is a heavy support weapon for your infantry and cavalry. Its task is to destroy the enemy walls and therefore increase your troops’ chances of overcoming the enemy's fortifications.
manual.tid58: The Stone Catapult is an excellent long-distance weapon; it is used to destroy the fields and buildings of enemy villages. However, without escorting troops, it is virtually defenseless, so don't forget to send some of your troops with it.<br /><br />Having a high-level rally point makes your catapults more accurate and gives you the option to target additional enemy buildings. More information is available <a href="http://t4.answers.travian.com/?view=answers&action=answer&aid=157#go2answer" target=blank>here</a>.HINT: Catapults CAN hit the cranny, trappers or stonemason's lodges when they target randomly.
manual.tid59: The Nomarch is the administrative leader of the Egyptians. They negotiate terms of surrender and, thanks to their charisma, they can win over enemy people to join your empire.<br /><br />With every visit of the Nomarch, the loyalty of the enemy’s population decreases until it is reduced to nothing and the people accept your rule.
manual.tid60: Settlers are brave and daring citizens who move out of the village after much training to establish a new village in your honor.<br /><br />As both the journey and the founding of the new village are very difficult, three settlers must stick together. They need basic supplies of 750 units per resource.
manual.tid61: The Mercenary is a jack-of-all-trades. Their offensive and defensive performance can easily be compared to other units, but they do not excel in any form of combat. However, their moderate abilities are reflected by their moderate training costs.
manual.tid62: The Bowman is your first choice for large offensive strikes. They love to be at the front lines, which is fortunate because of their puny defensive skills.
manual.tid63: The Spotter is a lightning-fast scout unit who detects the military and economic secrets of your enemies‘ villages and relays them back to you.
manual.tid64: The Steppe Rider is an outstanding attacker who undergoes training faster than most other mounted warriors. As a result, however, they are very weak in defensive combat.
manual.tid65: The Marksman is a well-rounded cavalry unit. Their solid attacking power is overshadowed by the fact that they are the only proficient defensive soldier of the Huns.
manual.tid66: The Marauder is an absolute force to be reckoned with. With incredible attacking power as well as impressive speed, they overrun most defenses without a scratch on their armor.
manual.tid67: The Ram is a heavy support weapon for your infantry and cavalry. Its task is to destroy the enemy walls and therefore increase your troops’ chances of overcoming the enemy's fortifications.
manual.tid68: The Catapult is an excellent long-distance weapon; it is used to destroy the fields and buildings of enemy villages. However, without escorting troops, it is virtually defenseless, so don't forget to send some of your troops with it.<br /><br />Having a high-level rally point makes your catapults more accurate and gives you the option to target additional enemy buildings. More information is available <a href="http://t4.answers.travian.com/?view=answers&action=answer&aid=157#go2answer" target=blank>here</a>.HINT: Catapults CAN hit the cranny, trappers or stonemason's lodges when they target randomly.
manual.tid69: The Logades have earned their position by defeating all challengers in a deadly battle of physical and mental prowess. Now they only leave home to conquer.<br /><br />Every time they step into the village of an enemy, their powerful presence reduces the loyalty of the people to their previous owner, until they decide to join your command.
manual.tid70: Settlers are brave and daring citizens who move out of the village after much training to establish a new village in your honor.<br /><br />As both the journey and the founding of the new village are very difficult, three settlers must stick together. They need a basic supplies of 750 units per resource.
manual.gid42: By building a Stone Wall, you can protect your village against the barbarian hordes of your enemies. The higher its level, the higher is the bonus given to your forces' defense.<br /><br />The Stone Wall can only be built by Egyptians, its defense bonus is like the Gaulish Palisade and its durability is comparable with the Teutonic Earth Wall.
manual.gid43: By building a Makeshift Wall, you can protect your village against the barbarian hordes of your enemies. The higher its level, the higher is the bonus given to your forces' defense.<br /><br />The Makeshift Wall can only be built by Huns, its defense bonus is lower than the Teutonic Earth Wall and its durability is comparable with the Roman City Wall.
manual.gid44: The Command Center is a small palace where the King or Queen resides when they visit the village. The Command Center protects the village against enemies who seek to conquer it.
manual.gid45: The Waterworks allows you to regulate the water flow to your oases. This not only helps to grow trees and crops, but it is also useful for quarries and mines as it supplies workers with water and resource transportation.<br /><br />This building increases the bonus of all annexed oases. Its maximum effect at level 20 doubles the effect of oases.<br /><br />The Waterworks can only be built by Egyptians.

production.title: Production overview
production.crobBalanceTroopConsumptionInOasis: - in oasis or reinforcements from own villages
production.crobBalanceTimeUntilStarvation: Time left before your granary is empty and troops will start to starve: [TIME_RANGE]

questV2.skip_tooltip: jump to the end of tutorial
questV2.no_quests_in_this_category: No further tasks available in this category.
questV2.tutorial_01_task_description: Hello [NAME], welcome to Travian!Until you found your next village, I will guide you through the game. In the tutorial, you will build up your village and learn more about the game's features and goals.
questV2.tutorial_01_step_01_todolist: The tutorial explains the main features of the game and only takes a couple of minutes - start now!
questV2.tutorial_02_task_description: You can move or close this window. To open it again, simply click on my image in the bottom-right corner. The hint will give you some help in case you have trouble with progressing in the tutorial.
questV2.tutorial_02_step_02_todolist: Click on the advisor to open the task window
questV2.tutorial_02_reward_description: Now you can always get information about your current tasks. The next task will be activated once you have collected your reward. Claim your clay pit now!
questV2.tutorial_02_reward: A clay pit at level 1 is waiting for you!
questV2.tutorial_03_task_description: You will need a lot of resources in order to build up your village, train troops and grow your empire. First increase your resource production - construct a woodcutter!
questV2.tutorial_03_step_01_todolist: Open a forest field by clicking on it
questV2.tutorial_03_step_02_todolist: Order the construction of a level 1 woodcutter
questV2.tutorial_03_reward_description: This is a good start on the way to greater economic power. I'll just finish the construction for you, so that we can continue.
questV2.tutorial_04_task_description: A larger building will require more resources with each upgrade, but in turn it will also produce more. Please upgrade the woodcutter from level 1 to level 2 now!
questV2.tutorial_04_step_02_todolist: Order the construction of a level 2 woodcutter
questV2.tutorial_04_reward_description: The display of your storage and stock can be found above your village. Construction costs will be taken from the stocks. I'll instantly finish the construction for you again.
questV2.tutorial_04_reward: Finish construction of woodcutter level 2 immediately
questV2.tutorial_05_task_description: When looking at your stocks, to the right you can see the free crop, which indicates the amount of crop available for new buildings. Buildings consume crop for their upkeep. Please construct a cropland now.
questV2.tutorial_05_step_01_todolist: Click on a crop field to open it
questV2.tutorial_05_reward_description: Your village now produces enough crop again to support new buildings. The population has to be fed locally, stationed troops can also be supported by crop deliveries.
questV2.tutorial_05_reward: Instantly finish construction of level 1 cropland and upgrade to level 2
questV2.tutorial_06_task_description: If your hero is alive, they can produce resources for their village. Our upgrades caused a lack of clay. Change the hero's production to clay now.
questV2.tutorial_06_step_01_todolist: Click on the hero's image and open the overview
questV2.tutorial_06_step_02_todolist: Change resources to clay and save
questV2.tutorial_06_reward_description: Nicely done. Your hero can help you out in times of resource scarcity. All resources they produce will always go to their home village, even if they are underway. I will just increase your stock a little.
questV2.tutorial_07_task_description: Next, we will increase the storage capacity for your resources. For this, we need a building inside your village. Go to your village overview by toggling the view in the menu at the top.
questV2.tutorial_08_task_description: Without a warehouse, only a few resources can be stored in your village. Click on any available free building site in your village! Search for the warehouse in the infrastructure tab of the construction menu and start construction.
questV2.tutorial_08_step_01_todolist: Open the construction menu and select the infrastructure tab
questV2.tutorial_08_step_02_todolist: Order the construction of a level 1 warehouse
questV2.tutorial_08_reward_description: Construction work has begun and soon you will have enough storage for your production and loot. I will give you one day of Travian PLUS, which allows you to queue a second construction order while the first one is still not finished.
questV2.tutorial_09_task_image: Free building site for rally point
questV2.tutorial_09_task_description: In order to send your hero on adventures, you need a rally point - you can find it in the centre of your village! Build it to level 1.
questV2.tutorial_09_step_01_todolist: Click on the rally point's building site
questV2.tutorial_09_step_02_todolist: Order the construction of a level 1 rally point
questV2.tutorial_09_reward_description: Great! The construction has been ordered and your hero can now be sent on their way. For this task, I will give you some gold, which we will put to good use right away.
questV2.tutorial_10_task_description: Below the village, you can find a list with all of your current construction orders. This time, you can speed up the construction yourself. Use the gold from the last task and finish the construction orders by clicking on "complete construction immediately".
questV2.tutorial_10_reward_description: Now you can send your hero on an adventure. First, order the construction of some more resource fields so your village keeps on growing. Take this gold and spend it wisely.
questV2.tutorial_11_task_description: Discover mysterious places in your surroundings to collect experience and valuable loot. Open the adventure list and send your hero on their first adventure.
questV2.tutorial_11_step_01_todolist: Send your hero on their first adventure
questV2.tutorial_11_reward_description: Great, your hero is on their way - what are they going to find? Below their image you can see the hero is underway. I will make them arrive now, so that we can see what happens.
questV2.tutorial_11_reward: Your hero immediately arrives at the adventure
questV2.tutorial_12_task_description: Your hero is now on their way back from the first adventure. In the menu at the top, you can find the reports. Open the report list and read the adventure report.
questV2.tutorial_12_reward_description: You can already see what kind of bounty you got in the overview. What was it for you? Also, your hero got slightly injured - to deal with this, I will now give them some ointments.
questV2.tutorial_13_task_description: Your hero was slightly injured. Open the hero overview by clicking on their image. Now click on the ointments in the inventory and use them with "ok". Only the required amount will be used.
questV2.tutorial_13_step_01_todolist: Click on your hero's image to open the inventory
questV2.tutorial_13_step_02_todolist: Click on the ointments in the inventory to use them
questV2.tutorial_13_reward_description: All items can be used this way. Depending on the item, it is either equipped or your hero consumes it. Further details can be found in any item's description.
questV2.tutorial_13_reward: Additionally, your hero receives 20 experience points.
questV2.tutorial_14_task_description: Near my image, you can find some additional help regarding the game. There, you can find explanations about the layout and different sections of the user interface. Just give it a try!
questV2.tutorial_14_step_01_todolist: Open the user interface help and have a look around the UI
questV2.tutorial_14_reward_description: In case you have a specific question, you can always check out our "Answers" first – and you will get help. For that, simply click on the 'i' in the header of this window or in the top corner of the screen.
questV2.tutorial_15_task_description: Now you know the basics of playing the game. Important information such as the end of your beginner's protection or special events can be found in the info box to the left. Enjoy playing Travian!
questV2.tutorial_15a_reward_description: To get you started, I will give you the buildings and advantages from the tutorial. Further tasks and rewards are waiting for you from now until you found your second village. Enjoy playing Travian!
questV2.tutorial_15a_reward: Rally point, clay pit, woodcutter 2, cropland 2, 10 gold, 1 day PLUS
questV2.battle_01_step_01_description: During the tutorial, you already collected some experience from an adventure. Start the next adventure as soon as your hero has returned to your village. Loot and experience will allow you to grow more quickly.
questV2.battle_01_step_01_todolist: Move on to the second adventure
questV2.battle_01_step_02_description: Nice, your hero is already on their way. Hint: The more fighting strength your hero has, the less damage they will take from adventures.
questV2.battle_02_step_01_description: Many players live off of robbing the resources from other players. At game start, you have beginner's protection and you are safe. Construct a cranny to save at least a part of your resources from being plundered.
questV2.battle_02_step_01_todolist: Build a cranny in your village
questV2.battle_02_step_02_description: Great, now plunderers will not find it as easy to steal from you anymore. Check the info box to see the time of beginner's protection you have left.
questV2.battle_03_step_01_description: The barracks is the first building that allows you to train troops. Even as a peace-loving player, you will need troops in order to protect yourself and your allies from enemies.
questV2.battle_03_step_02_description: Your barracks has been built! A good step towards world domination!
questV2.battle_04_step_01_description: Whenever your hero reaches a new level, they will get stronger. Open the hero's attributes and distribute the attribute points you have been awarded.
questV2.battle_04_step_01_todolist: Distribute your hero's attribute points after levelling up.
questV2.battle_04_step_02_description: You can change the distribution of points for each attribute at any time. All you need for this is a book of wisdom, which can be found in adventures.
questV2.battle_05_step_01_description: Now it is time to train your first troops. In the barracks, you can already train one type of infantry unit.
questV2.battle_05_step_01_todo_list: Train two troops in the barracks
questV2.battle_05_step_02_description: The cornerstone for a glorious army has been laid! Always remember that you can still be attacked, even when you are not online.
questV2.battle_06_step_01_description: Now you should also build some defences. A fortification will increase your base defence and also increases the fighting strength of defending troops.
questV2.battle_06_step_01_todo_list: Build a fortification around your village.
questV2.battle_06_step_02_description: Wonderful, the defenders of your village are now better protected.
questV2.battle_07_step_01_description: Search the map for a free oasis nearby and plunder it. In case there are animals defending it, send your hero equipped with cages in order to capture them.
questV2.battle_07_step_01_todolist: Open a free oasis on the map and attack it.
questV2.battle_07_step_02_description: Congratulations, your first attack is on its way! You can still cancel it for a short period of time from within your rally point.
questV2.battle_08_step_01_description: Continue to send your hero on adventures. After having finished 10 of them, you can participate in auctions and trade items with other players.
questV2.battle_08_step_02_description: Congratulations, you can now use the auction house. Take this silver, so you have some money for trading right away.
questV2.economy_01_step_01_description: Order the construction of an iron mine! Your primary aim is still a high production of resources so that you can grow quickly.
questV2.economy_01_step_01_todolist: Start the construction of an iron mine
questV2.economy_01_step_02_description: Higher iron production for your village. A production bonus will help you increase the production of any particular resource even further.
questV2.economy_01_step_02_reward: One day +25% bonus on the production of all resources
questV2.economy_02_step_01_description: Extend one lumber, clay, iron and crop field each to level 1. To complete this task you need to have at least 2 fields of each resource type above level 0. As long as Travian Plus is still active, you can always order one further construction at the same time.
questV2.economy_02_step_01_todolist: Extend one more of each resource tile to level 1.
questV2.economy_02_step_02_description: Congratulations! Your village grows and thrives...
questV2.economy_03_step_01_description: In order to store more crop, you need a granary. Your current storage limit can be found when looking at the resources bar.
questV2.economy_03_step_02_description: Nicely done! The granary now allows you to store more crop.
questV2.economy_04_step_01_description: In the beginning, it's best to focus on resources. Please upgrade all your resource fields to level 1.
questV2.economy_04_step_01_todolist: Upgrade all resource fields to level 1
questV2.economy_04_step_02_description: Your resource production is developing nicely. Soon we can start the construction of more buildings in your village.
questV2.economy_05_step_01_description: Continue to increase your production. Upgrade one lumber, clay, iron and crop field each to level 2!
questV2.economy_05_step_01_todolist: Upgrade one resource field each to level 2
questV2.economy_05_step_02_description: Well done! If you require more information regarding your production, click on your stocks.
questV2.economy_06_step_01_description: In case you have a lack of one resource, you can trade it for other resources with other players at the marketplace. In order to construct a small marketplace, you need a larger main building.
questV2.economy_06_step_02_description: Your marketplace is ready and you can now start trading with other players. Don't fall for the really bad offers though!
questV2.economy_07_step_01_description: Existing offers on the marketplace can be seen when clicking on "buy". Check the exchange rate and the distance. Should you not be able to find a suitable offer, click on "offer" to create an offer yourself.
questV2.economy_07_step_01_todolist: Create a marketplace offer or accept one
questV2.economy_07_step_02_description: Awesome, you have initiated your first trade.
questV2.economy_08_step_01_description: Before you start constructing more expensive buildings, we should further increase your resource production. Upgrade all your resource fields to level 2.
questV2.economy_08_step_01_todolist: Extend all resource fields to level 2
questV2.economy_08_step_02_description: Congratulations! Your resource production is developing nicely.
questV2.economy_09_step_01_description: It's time to adjust your warehouse to the increased production. Unplanned loot from your hero may also make your storage overflow.
questV2.economy_09_step_02_description: Really good, no valuable resources will be wasted now.
questV2.economy_10_step_01_description: The higher your production, the easier your storage gets filled up. The granary should also be upgraded.
questV2.economy_10_step_02_description: Now there is room again in the granary, so that production can continue even in your absence.
questV2.economy_11_step_01_description: A grain mill increases the production of all your croplands. In order to be worth its price, you need to have a high enough base production.
questV2.economy_11_step_03_description: Now you have a lot of free crop available for further constructions. There are also buildings that increase the production of the other resources.
questV2.economy_12_step_01_description: You will need a much higher production in order to spare you a long waiting time until you are able to afford the buildings and settlers needed for a second village. Upgrade all resource fields to level 5.
questV2.economy_12_step_01_todolist: Upgrade all resource fields to level 5
questV2.economy_12_step_02_description: Well done, you now have a decent production.
questV2.economy_12_step_02_reward: One day +25% bonus to the production of all resources .
questV2.world_01_step_01_description: In the world of Travian, you compete against thousands of other players. Check the statistics to find out more about your own position in the game.
questV2.world_01_step_01_todolist: Open the statistics and compare yourself with other players.
questV2.world_01_step_02_description: Apart from the rank, there is other useful information. The tab Top10 will show you the strongest attackers and the most successful robbers.
questV2.world_02_step_01_description: A village name chosen by you is a sign to other players, showing them that your empire is being led actively.
questV2.world_02_step_01_todolist: Change the village name on the village sign.
questV2.world_02_step_02_description: Nice, now you have completed the first step to leave your mark in the world of Travian.
questV2.world_03_step_01_description: A bigger main building unlocks new buildings and your workers' speed will increase. Being able to build more quickly will however only pay out if you produce enough resources.
questV2.world_03_step_01_todolist: Upgrade your main building to level 3.
questV2.world_03_step_02_description: Great, the bigger main building now allows you to construct some additional buildings that you've just unlocked.
questV2.world_04_step_01_description: The world of Travian is a dangerous place and you need to be able to defend yourself. The best additional defence is offered by strong allies. Construct an embassy in order to join an alliance.
questV2.world_04_step_02_description: Perfect, now you can accept alliance invitations. Invitations can be found inside the embassy.
questV2.world_05_step_01_description: The map shows you the world of Travian. Check out your neighbours to find allies and identify threats.
questV2.world_05_step_01_todolist: Open the map in the menu.
questV2.world_05_step_02_description: Are there strong players or alliances near you? The map also helps you find oases and spots where you can settle new villages.
questV2.world_06_step_01_description: You have just received a message with some helpful hints. Unread messages can be identified by the number above the button. Have a look now.
questV2.world_06_step_01_todolist: Open the messages overview and read the taskmaster's message!
questV2.world_06_step_02_description: Use messages to communicate with other players. It does always pay out to be calm and polite, even if you are at battle.
questV2.world_06_igmSubject: Advice for the start of the game
questV2.world_06_igmMessage: Hello [NAME],Travian is a game of domination through strategy and diplomacy. At the core, it is about standing up against other players. Seek allies to reach your goals; even the strongest players require assistance.The predominant task is always to survive and grow. In order to start on a sound footing, simply solve the tasks I give you. Protect your resources and villages from greedy neighbours. In case you are struggling, you can find some additional help here: [ANSWERS_FARM]At the start, you can often avoid enemy attacks, however you should defend yourself against conquer attempts. Without troops, you won't be able to help yourself nor your allies. More information here: [ANSWERS_TROOPS]Once the dust of the first battles has settled, the strongest alliances will start fighting for control of ever larger territories. They will destroy threats and competitors and form new alliances. Particularly strong alliances will later fight for control of powerful artefacts and - as a display of their own power - to be the first to erect a wonder of the world.Adjust your personal goals to the time you can spend playing - the more ambitious your aims, the more time will be required to build, negotiate and fight.But enough talking! Get together with old and new friends, fight your enemies - and have fun together!
questV2.world_08_step_01_description: Search for allies and join an alliance. If you don't have any contacts yet, check the alliances of players near you or search for an alliance on the forum.
questV2.world_08_step_02_description: We're off to a great start. The stronger and more active each single player is, the stronger you will be as a team. Have you found out how to report attacks to each other and how to ask for assistance?
questV2.world_09_step_01_description: It is time to upgrade the main building, so that you can construct new buildings. Please remember to also take care of your resource production at the same time.
questV2.world_09_step_01_todolist: Upgrade your main building to level 5.
questV2.world_09_step_02_description: Great, now you can construct a residence. Your workers' speed has also improved.
questV2.world_10_step_01_description: Construct a seat of government now in order to found a new village soon. In case you are not sure if you want this village to remain your capital village, please select the residence.
questV2.world_10_step_02_description: This building is necessary in order to settle a new village or conquer one. Its level limits the amount of possible expansions.
questV2.world_11_step_01_description: In order to reign over more villages in your empire, you need culture points. The overview in the residence or palace tells you how far away you are and how long it is going to take.
questV2.world_11_step_01_todolist: Open the culture points tab in your residence or palace.
questV2.world_11_step_02_description: In the village list you can also see the current status of possible new villages and the amount of missing culture points. Visit "Answers" to find out how to quickly increase your culture points.
questV2.world_12_step_01_description: Upgrade your warehouse to prepare yourself for settling a new village. Your current storage capacity won't be enough soon to afford the required buildings and settlers.
questV2.world_12_step_02_description: Great, your storage capacity should be enough for some time now. Remember to defend or hide your valuable resources.
questV2.world_13_step_01_description: The surroundings reports help you stay informed about events and changes within your neighbourhood.
questV2.world_13_step_01_todolist: Open the reports and read the surroundings reports.
questV2.world_13_step_02_description: From name changes to performed raids and conquerings, much is possible. I hope you enjoyed reading the reports.
questV2.world_14_step_01_description: Settlers can be trained in a palace or a residence. The tab "Train" shows you the required building level.
questV2.world_14_step_01_todolist: Upgrade your residence or palace to level 10.
questV2.world_14_step_02_description: From each village you can only control 2 to 3 new villages. All that's missing for a new village now are 3 settlers and a lot of culture points.
questV2.world_15_step_01_description: Settlers always travel in a small group when founding a new village. Protect your settlers well from attacks until they are ready to go.
questV2.world_15_step_02_description: Nice. Settlers will always take some resources for the new village with them, so they can start building it up right away.
questV2.world_16_step_01_description: Search the map for a good spot to settle. Would you like it to be near your village, produce more of one particular resource or be near many oases?
questV2.world_16_step_01_todolist: Found a second village using your settlers.
questV2.world_16_step_02_description: Well done. I'll now give you another 2 days of Travian Plus - this will do you some good.
questV2.battle_09_step_01_description: Go to the auction house and see which items are currently on offer. Maybe you want to turn some of your loot from adventures into silver as well?
questV2.battle_09_step_01_todolist: Create or place a bid in an auction.
questV2.battle_09_step_02_description: Great, now you know how to trade equipment and consumable items with other players.
questV2.battle_10_step_01_description: Upgrade your barracks now. With this, you fulfill the requirements to unlock further buildings.
questV2.battle_10_step_02_description: Nice. Your troops are now trained faster and you can construct an academy.
questV2.battle_11_step_01_description: New and stronger units for your village can be researched in the academy. Some units are very expensive and have high requirements before they can be researched.
questV2.battle_11_step_02_description: Well done. Soon you will find out more about the soldiers of your tribe.
questV2.battle_12_step_01_description: Check your research options now. There are infantry and cavalry units, as well as siege weapons. Units are mainly specialised in either attack or defence.
questV2.battle_12_step_02_description: Research alone is of course not enough; your units will also need to be trained.
questV2.battle_13_step_01_description: A smithy allows you to better arm and equip your soldiers. Furthermore, a smithy is required in order to build additional troop buildings.
questV2.battle_13_step_02_description: Perfect. Now you can better equip your soldiers.
questV2.battle_14_step_01_description: Improving your soldiers' equipment isn't cheap. The more soldiers you have, the more rewarding an improvement will be. This time, you will gain more than a refund of the costs.
questV2.battle_14_step_01_todolist: Research a unit improvement in the smithy.
questV2.battle_14_step_02_description: Perfect, now your troops' ability to attack and defend has improved.
questV2.noMoreTasksForThisCategory: No further tasks available in this category.
questV2.QuestSystemExceptionMessage: There has been an error with the task system.
questV2.world_07_step_01_description: I've prepared a small gift for you at the gold shop. Collect a small package of free gold there.
questV2.world_07_step_01_todolist: Go to the gold menu and claim the free gold from the taskmaster.
questV2.world_07_step_02_description: That wasn't so hard, was it? Check "advantages" to find out more about what you can use your gold for.
questV2.world_07a_step_01_description: I've prepared a small gift for you at the gold shop. Collect a small package of free gold there.
questV2.world_07a_step_01_todolist: Go to the gold menu and claim the free gold from the taskmaster.
questV2.world_07a_step_02_description: That wasn't so hard, was it? Check "advantages" to find out more about what you can use your gold for.
questV2.world_07b_step_01_description: During the tutorial, you've already used gold to speed up your construction orders. In the gold shop, you can find out what else you can use your gold for.
questV2.world_07b_step_01_todolist: Take a look at the advantages you can buy with gold.
questV2.world_07b_step_02_description: Here is some free gold again, so that you can make use of some of the gold advantages.
questV2.economy_11_rewarding_not_possible: The village which you selected does not contain a grain mill level 1.
questV2.world_06_igmMessageAEU: Hello [NAME],Travian is a game of domination through strategy and diplomacy. At the core, it is about standing up against other players. Seek allies to help you reach your goals; but even the strongest players require assistance.The predominant task is always to survive and grow. In order to start on sound footing, simply solve the tasks I give you. Protect your resources and villages from greedy neighbors. In case you are struggling, you can find some additional help here: [ANSWERS_FARM]At the start, you can often avoid enemy attacks, however you should defend yourself against conquer attempts. Without troops, you won't be able to help yourself nor your allies. More information here: [ANSWERS_TROOPS]Once the dust of the first battles has settled, the strongest alliances will start fighting for control of ever larger territories. They will destroy threats and competitors and form new alliances.Important starting hint - artefacts are tied to ancient cities. You can’t steal them and cart them off over the hills. You need to conquer the city to gain the effects of the artefact. In fact, when you have one, you have to choose how you will benefit from it: the artefact bonus or victory points. Please check the forums for more information about this.Adjust your personal goals to the time you can spend playing - the more ambitious your aims, the more time will be required to build, negotiate and fight.But enough of the talking! Get together with old and new friends, fight your enemies - and have fun together!
questV2.questLog_eventType_CheatShop: Player tried to cheat with shop task
questV2.questLog_whoYouThenCall: Please report to techsupport / developers with screenshot. Thanks.
questV2.battle_04_step_01_description2: Spend some attribute points on fighting strength, so your hero isn’t overwhelmed dealing with deadly adventures.
questV2.battle_04_step_01_todolist2: Spent at least one attribute point on fighting strength
questV2.battle_15_step_01_description: More Adventures mean more loot and experience. Keep your Hero active, but consider giving him some rest if his health is low.
questV2.battle_15_step_02_description: Ointments can be used to heal your hero. If you equip ointment it will be used as soon as the hero got damage.
questV2.world_06_igmMessageTerritory: Hello [NAME],Travian is a game of domination through strategy and diplomacy. At the core, it is about standing up against other players. Seek allies to help you reach your goals; but even the strongest players require assistance.The predominant task is always to survive and grow. In order to start on sound footing, simply solve the tasks I give you. Protect your resources and villages from greedy neighbors. In case you are struggling, you can find some additional help here: [ANSWERS_FARM]At the start, you can often avoid enemy attacks, however you should defend yourself against conquer attempts. Without troops, you won't be able to help yourself nor your allies. More information here: [ANSWERS_TROOPS]Once the dust of the first battles has settled, the strongest alliances will start fighting for control of ever larger territories. They will destroy threats and competitors and form new alliances.Important starting hint - Artifacts are tied to regions around ancient cities. You can’t steal them and cart them off over the hills nor can you conquer just the city to gain the effects of the artifact. In fact, your alliance needs to have as much population in the region as possible to gain access to the ancient powers. Please check the forums for more information about this.Adjust your personal goals to the time you can spend playing - the more ambitious your aims, the more time will be required to build, negotiate and fight.But enough of the talking! Get together with old and new friends, fight your enemies - and have fun together!
questV2.newvillage_01_step_01_description: Two villages are more lucrative than one! Order the construction of an iron mine in your second village.
questV2.newvillage_01_step_01_todolist: Start the construction of an iron mine in your second village
questV2.newvillage_01_step_02_description: Higher iron production for your second village. A production bonus will help you increase the production of a resource even further.
questV2.newvillage_01_step_02_reward: One day +25% bonus on the production of all resources
questV2.newvillage_02_step_01_description: In your second village, upgrade 2 fields of each resource type (iron, lumber, clay and crop) to level 1. Remember, as long as Travian PLUS is active, you can make use of an extra construction slot.
questV2.newvillage_02_step_01_todolist: In your second village, have two of each resource field upgraded to level 1
questV2.newvillage_02_step_02_description: Congratulations! Your second village grows and thrives...
questV2.newvillage_03_step_01_description: Expansion of wealth leads to expansion of power. Upgrade all resource fields in your second village to level 1!
questV2.newvillage_03_step_01_todolist: Upgrade all second village resource fields to level 1
questV2.newvillage_03_step_02_description: The second village’s resource production is developing nicely. Soon we can start the construction of more buildings in it.
questV2.newvillage_04_step_01_description: Continue to increase production in your second village. Upgrade one lumber, clay, iron and crop field each to level 2!
questV2.newvillage_04_step_01_todolist: In your second village, upgrade one of each resource field type to level 2
questV2.newvillage_04_step_02_description: Well done! As always, if you require more information regarding your production, check your stocks.
questV2.newvillage_05_step_01_description: Your second village is coming along nicely; but we should still increase your resource production. Upgrade all resource fields there to level 2.
questV2.newvillage_05_step_01_todolist: Upgrade all second village resource fields to level 2
questV2.newvillage_05_step_02_description: Soon your second village will rival your first!
questV2.newvillage_06_step_01_description: A grain mill boosts the production of all croplands of a village. But first, you need to have a high enough base production for it to be worthwhile.
questV2.newvillage_06_step_02_description: Now that you have a high enough base production, time to get a grain mill!
questV2.newvillage_06_step_03_description: More crop available allows for more construction! Be sure to also construct buildings which boost production of other resource types.
questV2.newvillage_07_step_01_description: The higher your production, the sooner you can afford the buildings and settlers needed for your next village. Upgrade all resource fields in the second village to level 5.
questV2.newvillage_07_step_01_todolist: Upgrade all resource fields in the second village to level 5
questV2.newvillage_07_step_02_description: Well done on increasing production in your second village!
questV2.newvillage_07_step_02_reward: One day +25% bonus to the production of all resources
questV2.newvillage_08_step_01_description: It is time to upgrade the main building of your second village. Doing so allows the construction new buildings. Please remember to also take care of your resource production at the same time.
questV2.newvillage_08_step_01_todolist: Upgrade main building of the second village to level 5
questV2.newvillage_08_step_02_description: Great, now you can construct a residence in your second village. Your workers' speed has also improved.
questV2.newvillage_09_step_01_description: Construct a seat of government now in order to found your next village soon. In case you are not sure whether you want this village to remain your capital village, please select the residence.
questV2.newvillage_09_step_01_todolist: Construct a residence or palace in your second village
questV2.newvillage_09_step_02_description: This building is necessary in order to settle a new village or conquer one. Its level limits the amount of possible expansions.
questV2.newvillage_10_step_01_description: In order to reign over more villages in your empire, you need culture points. The overview in the residence or palace tells you how far away you are and how long it is going to take.
questV2.newvillage_10_step_01_todolist: Open the culture points tab in your residence or palace of your second village.
questV2.newvillage_10_step_02_description: In the village list you can also see the current status of possible new villages and the amount of missing culture points. Visit "Answers" to find out how to quickly increase your culture points.
questV2.newvillage_11_step_01_description: Settlers can be trained in a palace or a residence. The tab "Train" shows you the required building level.
questV2.newvillage_11_step_01_todolist: Upgrade residence or palace in the second village to level 10
questV2.newvillage_11_step_02_description: From each village you can only control 2 to 3 new villages. All that's missing for a new village now are 3 settlers and a lot of culture points.
questV2.newvillage_12_step_01_description: Settlers always travel in a small group when founding a new village. Protect your settlers well from attacks until they are ready to go.
questV2.newvillage_12_step_02_description: Nice! Settlers will always take some resources for the new village with them, so they can start building it up right away.
questV2.newvillage_06_rewarding_not_possible: The village which you selected does not contain a grain mill level 1.
questV2.world_07b_step_01_descriptionROA: Gold can be used to speed up your construction orders. Additionally in the gold shop you can find out what else you can use your gold for.
questV2.newvillage_06_step_02_description2: Now that you have a high enough base production of crop in one of your new villages, it's time to add a grain mill!
questV2.newvillage_06_step_02_todolist2: Construct a level 1 grain mill in one of your new villages
questV2.battle_16_step_01_description: In Travian: Rise of Alliances you start with six settlers and you can settle a new village right at the start of the game. Go to the map and find a close position to settle a new village.
questV2.battle_16_step_01_todolist: Found a second village using your settlers.
questV2.battle_16_step_02_description: You have three settlers left - with this resource award you can settle another village.
questV2.world_06_igmMessageAS2017: Hello [NAME],The forces of Fire and Sand have left their mark on Europe. To make sure you’re not left uninformed and unprepared, we have summarized everything that has changed from the normal Travian experience.Of course, there are the two new tribes. The Huns and Egyptians should bring a massive shift in power and greatly mix up the battlefield. To make sure those battles happen frequently, we also decreased the size of the map from 801x801 to 401x401. Get ready for concentrated action.Following tradition, this action will take place on the map of Europe. This includes the regions, which replace the artifacts. The alliance holding the majority in that region claims the regional power, as opposed to the player owning the artifact and its effect. The random bonus known as the Fool’s Artifact has been completely removed. Regions that had this bonus previously now produce more victory points.Speaking of victory points, they are the winning condition on this game world. There are no world wonders. Instead, the end of this game world is already set: [GAME_END_DATE]. The race is on. Last but not least, the Tournament Square and the Trade Office give twice the bonus they normally would.Things truly are not like they were before. Keep your eyes open, and your wits sharp. Welcome to the world of Fire and Sand!
questV2.world_06_igmMessageAS2018: Hello [NAME],The Path to Pandora is beset with uncertainty. To make sure you’re not left uninformed and unprepared, we have summarized everything that has changed from the normal Travian experience.The Huns and Egyptians return once again! What's more, the buildings in your village now have a unique look for each tribe. But don't worry about having to choose only one. If you conquer a village from another tribe, it will stay as a village of that tribe. This is not to be taken lightly. Entirely new strategies will be required to prevail.Teamwork will be more important than ever. To encourage this collaboration, you can forward troop reinforcements within your alliance. Plus, you have the option to merge your own armies into one. Troops from one of your villages can be incorporated into another village of yours, if both villages belong to the same tribe. You can learn more about this in the answers section: [LINK_FORWARDING] and [LINK_INCORPORATE]Following tradition, the action will take place on the map of Europe. This includes the regions, which replace the artifacts. The alliance holding the majority in a region claims the regional power, as opposed to the player owning the artifact and its effect. Victory points are the winning condition on this game world. There are no world wonders. Instead, the end of this game world is already set: [GAME_END_DATE]. Read more details about regions, ancient powers, and victory points in our answers section: [LINK_REGIONS_AND_VICTORYPOINTS]Things truly are not like they were before. Are you brave enough to face the chaos of the Path to Pandora?The battle begins now.
